paragraphs: The Author's Desk dominates the heart of the Archives—a monumental workspace carved from dark wood that seems to breathe. Papers cover every surface, each covered in handwriting that shifts between languages, some that no living tongue has spoken in centuries.

At the center of it all rests a manuscript bound in leather the color of dried blood. This is the Editor's work—a document that rewrites stories at their source, cutting scenes, changing endings, deciding which narratives deserve to exist.
The Understudy appears beside you, their form now solid—a young performer in rehearsal black, holding a script marked through with red ink.

"You've found it," they say quietly. "The truth behind the disturbances. The Editor isn't just maintaining the Understage. They're rewriting it. Every cut scene, every abandoned character, every story that didn't fit their vision—all stored here, waiting to be used or erased."
They gesture to the manuscript, and you see that the ink is still wet, forming new words even as you watch.
"The Editor plans a Great Revision. A single story that replaces all others. No more branching paths. No more unexpected endings. No more choices."
The Understudy studies you carefully, their expression shifting as they sense the alliances you've forged in the Understage.

"You've chosen your path, Prompter. The factions have taken note of your journey. Whatever you believe about stories—whether they should be preserved, revised, freed, or balanced—those beliefs will shape what comes next."
"The Mainstage awaits, and the Editor will not step aside willingly. But you are no longer alone in this story."
Above the desk, the walls of the Archives begin to dissolve, revealing a vast darkness beyond—the Mainstage awaits. The final act approaches.
